oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dia!kwain (David Hoesar) (V)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The near approach of a 'Commando' is heralded by a mist. In the Katkop dialect, by Dia!kwain (L V.-16. 5199-5205). The |xam can tell when a commando is coming to attack them by the mist that comes in the morning. 1) This story was told to Dia!kwain by his father (Xaa-ttin), 2) pp.5173-5260 were translated in April 1912; except for pp.5206-5209, 3) This story is found in Book V-16.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: How the approach of a commando is foretold by the mist
